attributes.action: UK Government to ensure Nigel Farage MEP does NOT get a seat in House of Lords
attributes.additional_details:
On BBC Hard Talk, Nigel Farage: "Europe has been hijacked by a gang of unelected bureaucrats"
Nigel Farage, 18 May 2016:
If people feel that voting doesn’t change anything, then violence is the next step." 
Independent, 20 July 2016:
Nearly 40,000 people have lodged a complaint with the police alleging that Nigel Farage incited racial and religious hatred during the EU referendum campaign. 
Metro, 6 Nov 2016 Nigel Farage today warned of 'riots in the streets' over the High Court's Brexit ruling.
attributes.background: UKIP MEP Nigel Farage says he is a man of the people and his stance against unelected bureaucrats and elitism is well documented. He is also a highly divisive figure who uses incitement as a means to achieve political ambition. It would therefore be inappropriate to ascend him to the House of Lords.
